title: I had a blast playing ‘Squid Game Virtuals’ at a VR arcade — but here’s why I likely won’t return
description: After years of hype, virtual reality still hasn’t achieved mainstream consumer adoption. But it sure helped my group of friends have a ton of fun earlier this month. We spent a weeknight at Sandbox VR in Seattle, one of more than 45 locations worldwide where the San Francisco-based startup offers virtual reality experiences for groups of 2-to-6 people. VR arcades are not new, though the technology has improved over the years. Sandbox survived the pandemic shutdowns and is now growing quickly after raising $37 million two years ago. It added 12 locations this year with plans for more in 2024.… Read More
